original_solution_mapping.L3: So he uses 800-160=<<800-160=640>>640 arrows a week
original_solution_mapping.L4: The cost for those arrows would come out to 640*5.5=$<<640*5.5=3520>>3520 per week
original_solution_mapping.L5: His team pays for 3520*.7=$<<3520*.7=2464>>2464 of that

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6403.
    Returns: the amount the archer spends for arrows a week.
    """
    # L1
    shots_per_day = 200 # shoot 200 shots
    days_per_week = 4 # 4 days a week
    total_shots_per_week = shots_per_day * days_per_week

    # L2
    recovery_rate = 0.2 # recover 20% of his arrows
    recovered_arrows = total_shots_per_week * recovery_rate

    # L3
    arrows_used_per_week = total_shots_per_week - recovered_arrows

    # L4
    cost_per_arrow = 5.5 # cost $5.5 per arrow
    total_cost_before_team_contribution = arrows_used_per_week * cost_per_arrow

    # L5
    team_contribution_rate = 0.7 # pay for 70% of the cost of his arrows
    team_paid_amount = total_cost_before_team_contribution * team_contribution_rate

    # L6
    archer_cost_per_week = total_cost_before_team_contribution - team_paid_amount

    # FA
    answer = archer_cost_per_week
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He can recover {total_shots_per_week}*{recovery_rate}=<<{total_shots_per_week}*{recovery_rate}={recovered_arrows}>>{recovered_arrows} of those arrows
So he uses {total_shots_per_week}-{recovered_arrows}=<<{total_shots_per_week}-{recovered_arrows}={arrows_used_per_week}>>{arrows_used_per_week} arrows a week

The cost for those arrows would come out to {arrows_used_per_week}*{cost_per_arrow}=$<<{arrows_used_per_week}*{cost_per_arrow}={total_cost_before_team_contribution}>>{total_cost_before_team_contribution} per week
His team pays for {total_cost_before_team_contribution}*{team_contribution_rate}=$<<{total_cost_before_team_contribution}*{team_contribution_rate}={team_paid_amount}>>{team_paid_amount} of that

So he has to pay {total_cost_before_team_contribution}-{team_paid_amount}=$<<{total_cost_before_team_contribution}-{team_paid_amount}={archer_cost_per_week}>>{archer_cost_per_week} per week for arrows

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: So he has to pay 3520-448=$<<3520-448=3072>>3072 per week for arrows

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'arrows_used_per_week' (value: 640.0) was used instead of 'total_cost_before_team_contribution' (value: 3520.0).
